Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (mostly lost); small patch of added red in centre of sherd; possible traces of two faded added white bands near bottom; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of body, wing with red patch and foreleg of sphinx to right; part of rising horseshoe roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 263, no. 545)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0472) (phase 2)
